title: Anatomy-Based Problem-Solving Project Utilizing Proximal Peer Teaching

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-Level Understanding of Basic Anatomy and Biology
context.additional_context: Learners consist of general citizens who perform project activities in smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments. Focuses on applying anatomical concepts to everyday problem-solving.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately describe anatomical structures and functions using standardized anatomical terminology.
Learners can complete ≥80% of anatomy-based problem-solving projects through collaborative work with peers.
Learners can apply knowledge acquired through proximal peer teaching in three or more feedback sessions

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
